sen.j: 高木 貞作（たかぎ ていさく、嘉永元年11月23日 (旧暦)（1848年12月18日） - 昭和8年（1933年）1月14日）は、幕末の桑名藩士で、新選組隊士。
sen.e: Teisaku TAKAGI (December 18, 1848 - January 14, 1933) was a feudal retainer of Kuwana Domain and member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto) at the end of Edo period.
Teisaku TAKAGI (December 18, 1848 - January 14, 1933) was a feudal retainer of Kuwana Domain and a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto) at the end of Edo period.
sen.cmt: a member に変更しました。
sen.e: Teisaku TAKAGI (December 18, 1848 - January 14, 1933) was a feudal retainer of Kuwana Domain and a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto) at the end of Edo period.
Later he became a professor of Hitotsubashi University.
Later he became a professor of Hitotsubashi University.
Later he became a professor of Hitotsubashi University.
His common name was Gojiro.
He was commonly called as Gojiro.
sen.cmt: 全体的に変更しました。
sen.e: He was commonly called as Gojiro.
His alias was Shiro KANBE.
His alias was Shiro KANBE.
His alias was Shiro KANBE.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争時、藩主・松平定敬の命を受けて、山脇正勝と共に恭順派の家老・吉村権左衛門を殺害。
sen.e: At the time of Boshin Civil War, Teisaku and Masakatsu YAMAWAKI killed Gonzaemon YOSHIMURA, a chief retainer of the deference faction, ordered by Sadaki MATSUDAIRA, their lord.
At the time of Boshin Civil War, Teisaku and Masakatsu YAMAWAKI killed Gonzaemon YOSHIMURA who was a chief retainer of the deference faction, ordered by their lord, Sadaaki MATSUDAIRA.
sen.cmt: 後半部分を変更しました。
sen.e: At the time of Boshin Civil War, Teisaku and Masakatsu YAMAWAKI killed Gonzaemon YOSHIMURA who was a chief retainer of the deference faction, ordered by their lord, Sadaaki MATSUDAIRA.

sen.j: 定敬の後を追って蝦夷地へ渡る。
sen.e: He crossed into Ezo chi (inhabited area of Ainu, the current Hokkaido) following Sadaki.
He crossed into Ezo chi (inhabited area of Ainu, the current Hokkaido) following Sadaaki.
He crossed into Ezo chi (inhabited area of Ainu, the current Hokkaido) following Sadaaki.

sen.j: 渡航後は土方歳三配下の新選組に所属し、箱館戦争に参戦。
sen.e: After moving to Ezo, he belonged to the Shinsengumi under the command of Toshizo HIJIKATA and joined Hakodate War.
After moving to Ezo, he belonged to the Shinsengumi under the command of Toshizo HIJIKATA and joined Hakodate War.
After moving to Ezo, he belonged to the Shinsengumi under the command of Toshizo HIJIKATA and joined Hakodate War.

sen.j: 敗戦後、明治5年(1872年)に釈放されたが、家老殺害の罪を避けて渡米した。
sen.e: After losing the war, Teisaku was released in 1872, but went to the United States of America to avoid accusation of killing the chief retainer.
After losing the war, Teisaku was released in 1872, but went to the United States of America to avoid accusation of killing the chief retainer.
After losing the war, Teisaku was released in 1872, but went to the United States of America to avoid accusation of killing the chief retainer.

sen.j: アメリカ合衆国で商法を学んで明治8年（1875年）に帰国。
sen.e: He learned the commercial law in the USA and returned to Japan in 1875.
He learned the commercial law in the USA and returned to Japan in 1875.
He learned the commercial law in the USA and returned to Japan in 1875.

sen.j: 一橋大学設立に携わり、商業簿記の教授に就任した。
sen.e: Teisaku was involved with the establishment of Hitotsubashi University and appointed to a professorship in commercial book-keeping.
Teisaku was involved with the establishment of Hitotsubashi University and appointed to a professorship in commercial book-keeping.
Teisaku was involved with the establishment of Hitotsubashi University and appointed to a professorship in commercial book-keeping.

sen.j: 昭和8年、東京の自宅で他界。
sen.e: He died at his home in Tokyo in 1933.
He died at his home in Tokyo in 1933.
He died at his home in Tokyo in 1933.
He was eighty-six years old.
He was eighty-six years old.
He was eighty-six years old.

sen.j: 墓所は三重県桑名市法盛寺。
sen.e: His graveyard is Hojo-ji Temple in Kuwana City, Mie Prefecture.
His graveyard is Hojo-ji Temple in Kuwana City, Mie Prefecture.
His graveyard is Hojo-ji Temple in Kuwana City, Mie Prefecture.
